etymologies: early 17th century: perhaps from Low German and Dutch pal (related to pal ‘fixed’)

definitions: a pivoted curved bar or lever whose free end engages with the teeth of a cogwheel or ratchet so that the wheel or ratchet can only turn or move one way.
shortDefinitions: pivoted curved bar or lever whose free end engages with teeth of cogwheel or ratchet so that wheel or ratchet

definitions: each of a set of short stout bars that engage with the whelps and prevent a capstan, windlass, or winch from recoiling.
shortDefinitions: each of set of short bars that engage with whelps and prevent capstan
